question: Question_05
statement:
Let $a_1, a_2, a_3, \ldots$ be real numbers. Prove, using induction,
that for all $n \in \mathbb{N}$,

\begin{align*}\left| \sum_{k=1}^n a_k \right| \leq \sum_{k=1}^n |a_k|\end{align*}

You may assume the Triangle Inequality in the form

\begin{align*}|x+y| \leq |x| + |y|\end{align*} for all real numbers \emph{x} and \emph{y}.
sols:
We use induction.

In the base case when $n=1$ we have $|a_1|\leq |a_1|$ so the statement
is true.

Induction step: we assume that $|\sum_{i-1}^na_i|\leq \sum_{i=1}^n|a_i|$
holds for some (fixed) value $n \in N$. Then it also holds for $n+1$:

\begin{align*}
|\sum_{i-1}^{n+1}a_i|&=|\sum_{i-1}^{n}a_i+a_{n+1}|\\
&\leq |\sum_{i-1}^{n}a_i|+|a_{n+1}|\\
& \leq \sum_{i=1}^n|a_i|+|a_{n+1}|\\
&= \sum_{i=1}^{n+1}|a_i|\end{align*}

Where the first inequality is true by the triangle inequality and the
second by induction hypothesis. This finishes the induction step and so
the result is true for all $n\in N$ by induction.
